answerText: Borneo [10] Borneo is bounded on the east by the Makassar Strait, which separates it from this oddly-shaped Indonesian island also known as Sulawesi.
heading: ACF Winter |2009 | UC Los Angeles B and Iowa | 10 | Geography | None | College
subject: Geography
question: Question: Much of its western half is drained by the Kapuas River- the longest river system in all of Indonesia.   [10] Identify this third-largest island in the world, which is also home to the Sultanate of Brunei.
